adjective.description: (of a person or animal) unable to walk normally because of an injury or illness affecting the leg or foot.
(of an explanation or excuse) unconvincingly feeble.
examples: it was a lame statement and there was no excusing his behavior

noun.description: Fabric with interwoven gold or silver threads.

examples: somebody lamed him with a stone

origin: Old English lama, of Germanic origin, related to Dutch lam and German lahm<br>1920s: French, from Latin lamina (see lamina).
